item.title: Bronson add a quote by Ayn Rand
item.description: "Who is John Galt?" -- Ayn Rand

item.title: Bronson add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "I like this place and could willingly waste my time in it." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Bronson add a quote by Tennessee Williams
item.description: "I have always depended on the kindness of strangers." -- Tennessee Williams

item.title: Bronson add a quote by Jonathan Safran Foer
item.description: "I'm sorry for my inability to let unimportant things go, for my inability to hold on to the important things." -- Jonathan Safran Foer

item.title: Bronson add a quote by Ayn Rand
item.description: "The question isn't who is going to let me; it's who is going to stop me." -- Ayn Rand

item.title: Bronson add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description:
"Macbeth: If we should fail?
Lady Macbeth: We fail? But screw your courage to the sticking place, And we'll not fail." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Bronson add a quote by Charlotte Brontë
item.description: "Jane, be still; don't struggle so like a wild, frantic bird, that is rending its own plumage in its desperation." "I am no bird; and no net ensnares me; I am a free human being, with an independent will; which I now exert to leave you." -- Charlotte Brontë

item.title: Bronson add a quote by Jen Lancaster
item.description:
"I’m busy sorting through our new collection of rhinestone jewelry. Should anyone be in the market for sparkly accessories the size of a hubcap, this is the place to get them. Earlier today, a customer picked up one of the enormous chandelier-style offerings and asked, 'Do those be genuine rhimestones?'
I couldn’t even begin to explain everything that was wrong with her sentence, so I simply replied, 'Yes. They do be genuine." -- Jen Lancaster

item.title: Bronson add a quote by Ayn Rand
item.description: "The hardest thing to explain is the glaringly evident which everybody has decided not to see." -- Ayn Rand

item.title: Bronson add a quote by Jonathan Safran Foer
item.description: "She had fallen in love so many times that she began to suspect she was not falling in love at all, but doing something much more ordinary." -- Jonathan Safran Foer

item.title: Bronson add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "You speak an infinite deal of nothing." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Bronson add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "I would challenge you to a battle of wits, but I see you are unarmed!" -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Bronson add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "I am afraid I interrupt your solitary ramble, my dear sister,' said he, as he joined her. 'You certainly do,' she replied with a smile; 'but it does not follow that the interruption must be unwelcome." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Bronson add a quote by Thomas Hardy
item.description: "Why is it that a woman can see from a distance what a man cannot see close?" -- Thomas Hardy

item.title: Bronson add a quote by Thomas Hardy
item.description: "Is a woman a thinking unit at all, or a fraction always wanting its integer?" -- Thomas Hardy

item.title: Bronson add a quote by Thomas Hardy
item.description: "Where we are would be Paradise to me, if you would only make it so." -- Thomas Hardy

item.title: Bronson add a quote by George Eliot
item.description: "Blessed is the man who, having nothing to say, abstains from giving us wordy evidence of the fact." -- George Eliot

item.title: Bronson add a quote by George Eliot
item.description: "And, of course men know best about everything, except what women know better." -- George Eliot

item.title: Bronson add a quote by Willa Cather
item.description: "There are some things you learn best in calm, and some in storm." -- Willa Cather

item.title: Bronson add a quote by Jean de La Fontaine
item.description: "A person often meets his destiny on the road he took to avoid it." -- Jean de La Fontaine

item.title: Bronson add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "I love deadlines. I love the whooshing noise they make as they go by." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Bronson add a quote by Alfred Lord Tennyson
item.description: "Hope Smiles from the threshold of the year to come, Whispering 'it will be happier'..." -- Alfred Lord Tennyson

item.title: Bronson add a quote by Jack London
item.description: "Don't loaf and invite inspiration; light out after it with a club." -- Jack London

item.title: Bronson add a quote by Bernard Malamud
item.description: "There comes a time in a man's life when to get where he has to go--if there are no doors or windows--he walks through a wall." -- Bernard Malamud

item.title: Bronson add a quote by Anthony Trollope
item.description: "A small daily task, if it be really daily, will beat the labours of a spasmodic Hercules." -- Anthony Trollope

item.title: Bronson add a quote by Robert Browning
item.description: "Who hears music, feels his solitude Peopled at once." -- Robert Browning

item.title: Bronson add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Behind every exquisite thing that existed, there was something tragic." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Bronson add a quote by Oprah Winfrey
item.description: "True forgiveness is when you can say, "Thank you for that experience." -- Oprah Winfrey

item.title: Bronson add a quote by John Green
item.description: "I was blind and heart broken and didn't want to do anything and Gus burst into my room and shouted, "I have wonderful news!" And I was like, "I don't really want to hear wonderful news right now," and Gus said, "This is wonderful news you want to hear," and I asked him, "Fine, what is it?" and he said, "You are going to live a good and long life filled with great and terrible moments that you cannot even imagine yet!" -- John Green

item.title: Bronson add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "I think... if it is true that there are as many minds as there are heads, then there are as many kinds of love as there are hearts." -- Leo Tolstoy
